    • Method Detail

      • getAuthorisationToken

        public TokenAuthorisation getAuthorisationToken()
        This method is used to generate a valid request token for user based authentication.

        A request token is required in order to request a session id.

        You can generate any number of request tokens but they will expire after 60 minutes.

        As soon as a valid session id has been created the token will be destroyed.

      • getSessionToken

        public TokenSession getSessionToken(TokenAuthorisation token)
        This method is used to generate a session id for user based authentication.

        A session id is required in order to use any of the write methods.

        Parameters:
        token -

      • getLoginToken

        public TokenAuthorisation getLoginToken(TokenAuthorisation token,
                                        java.lang.String user,
                                        java.lang.String pwd)
        Try to validate TokenAuthorisation with username and password.
        Parameters:
        token - A TokenAuthorisation previously generated by getAuthorisationToken
        user - username
        pwd - password
        Returns:
        The validated TokenAuthorisation. The same as input with getSuccess()==true

      • getSessionLogin

        public TokenSession getSessionLogin(java.lang.String username,
                                    java.lang.String password)
        Does all the necessary username/password authentication stuff in one go

        Generates a new valid TokenAuthorisation

        Validates the Token via username/password

        requests a new session id with the validated TokenAuthorisation and returns a new TokenSession which one may want to transform into SessionToken for APO calls that require a authorized user.

        Returns:
        validated TokenSession
        Throws:
        MovieDbException - if the login failed

      • getGuestSessionToken

        public TokenSession getGuestSessionToken()
        This method is used to generate a guest session id.

        A guest session can be used to rate movies without having a registered TMDb user account.

        You should only generate a single guest session per user (or device) as you will be able to attach the ratings to a TMDb user account in the future.

        There are also IP limits in place so you should always make sure it's the end user doing the guest session actions.

        If a guest session is not used for the first time within 24 hours, it will be automatically discarded.
